com.jcraft.jsch

Class UserAuthGSSAPIWithMIC

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jcraft.jsch.UserAuth
      • com.jcraft.jsch.UserAuthGSSAPIWithMIC

  • public class UserAuthGSSAPIWithMIC
extends UserAuth
    Usually not to be used by applications. Implements the User Authentication method gssapi-with-mic as described in RFC 4462, section 3, which works by using the GSS-API on both client and server.

    For now, we only support the mechanism 1.2.840.113554.1.2.2, i.e. Kerberos 5 authentication (but more could be added by simply changing some private constants in the class, and adding the corresponding GSSContext implementation).

    For the actual method-specific calculations we use an implementation of GSSContext which wraps a GSS-API implementation. We will get an implementation class name from the configuration, then instantiate it with the no-argument constructor. To create a context, the create method will be called. After this, we initialize the context with init (using maybe more than one such call) to authenticate the user. Then we use once getMIC to sign some data (containing the SSH session identifier), increasing resistance against man-in-the-middle attacks (where the session identifier will be different on both sides).

    See Also:
    RFC 4462: Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSS-API) Authentication and Key Exchange for the Secure Shell (SSH) Protocol
